column1: Thank you for your important work especially as we continue to battle #COVID19.  #GiveThanks
Disclaimer: This photo was taken last year before COVID-19.

Yesterday I met with business owners and employees in Perry Co. to hear directly from them on how COVID has affected their businesses and to see what further support they need.  To help keep these pillars of our communities open be sure to #shopsmall and #shoplocal. https://t.co/zHcXyG9IV1

This order will provide 4th graders whose free access to our National Parks was disrupted by COVID continued access throughout 5th grade.  Especially during the pandemic the outdoors have huge mental physical & educational benefits.    The full letter: https://t.co/Um0lDbnxbX

In #Ohio addiction-related deaths were decreasing but as #COVID continues the number of these deaths has spiked.  It’s clear that we must remain vigilant and work together in the fight against addiction.

I stopped by the zoo to hear how they have been impacted during #COVID and how they have safely reopened so families can continue enjoying this great outdoor attraction in a safe socially distanced manner.

ATTN Circleville: There will be FREE COVID testing near you on Saturday.   ➡️WHERE: Second Baptist Church ➡️WHEN: 9 a.m. - 1 p.m.  Ohioans can find additional testing sites in your area at https://t.co/XH6c5rqeG7. https://t.co/x1F77K7pkU

This week I had the chance to talk with Stan Gigi and Charlotte of La Chatelaine Bakery about how #COVID has affected their business.  Though PPP loans have been helpful to small businesses this pandemic has created unprecedented obstacles and challenges for our restaurants. https://t.co/jysy2Y3QC8

We continued the 2020 series of Opioid & Addiction Roundtables in Circleville to discuss policy ideas and local initiatives. @CDCgov reported that overdose deaths decreased this year. That's reason to be optimistic.  But we can't lose sight of the addiction epidemic amidst COVID. https://t.co/1joLNMHbRv

If you are down this way pop in these great businesses and help them make up for lost revenue they will face this year. Nearly 400000 less people will be visiting the community for the Greatest Free Show on Earth due to coronavirus restrictions.   https://t.co/I31H45ubZE

I toured Circleville's downtown to hear from some incredible small business owners on how COVID has affected them and how they are adapting after the Pumpkin Show's cancellation.   I'm proud of their resilience and will continue fighting for more relief to support Main Street. https://t.co/aSNQIjV0sp

✅I got a flu shot at Circleville Apothecary one of many local pharmacies offering flu shots.  It's especially important to get a flu shot this year. This will help protect at-risk neighbors & reduce hospital visits during the COVID pandemic.  More info: https://t.co/Cp4ySaUJCW https://t.co/KaeNMHznBW

September marks the 5th straight month of job gains since #COVID19 shut down huge segments of our economy.   I'll continue pushing for legislation and efforts right in #OH15 to build on this momentum and continue fostering job creation.   https://t.co/e6JuSHJ2rO

This event has consistently spurred policy ideas & local initiatives to support preventative measures treatment housing & employment assistance for those battling addiction. As opioid-related deaths have spiked during #COVID19 these conversations are more important than ever.

#COVID19 is hurting the millions of our neighbors already struggling with food insecurity. I’m grateful to have had the opportunity to join @_MealsOnWheels earlier this month to help deliver meals to folks in #OH15.

Since the #COVID19 pandemic started we have all seen just how important telehealth is. It's a tool that has been crucial in getting our communities back on track which is why I urged @CMSgov to continue investing in telehealth services.   ⬇️Read the letter below. https://t.co/B39DrUwVIk

Today I met with Amanda from @dtlancasteroh to learn more on the obstacles restaurants and businesses are facing due to the #COVID19 pandemic. We need to continue working together on solutions that get us back to the booming economy in #OH15. https://t.co/SPGxsYjWgV

ICYMI: Farmers & producers now have a new opportunity to access much needed relief.  The @USDA’s Farm Service Agency opened applications for their Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. Applications are open until August 28. To apply visit https://t.co/pc3q8A0A1y. https://t.co/HZohJDDiIm

We are facing a 10% unemployment rate and #COVID19 can make it difficult to connect with potential employers. My upcoming virtual job fair is one way I'm working to ensure folks in #OH15 can safely find a job. For more information visit https://t.co/E5Q8xOQDfG. https://t.co/F7uP6DQG9F

That’s why next month I’m hosting a VIRTUAL job fair so that folks can make connections with potential employers while still staying safe during #COVID19. To learn more about the job fair visit https://t.co/E5Q8xOQDfG. https://t.co/BGeMIMc5XK

Free #COVID19 testing will be open to all tomorrow August 7th at Athens High School from 1PM to 6PM.   Find more on this site and other sites near you at https://t.co/427Vxdhmlu. https://t.co/dPb7ah5sZg

JUST IN: Free #COVID19 testing will be open to all tomorrow August 4th at the Fairfield County Fairgrounds from 12PM to 7PM.   Find more on this site and other sites near you at https://t.co/427Vxdhmlu. https://t.co/MgH4yaRjQb

ATTN Veterans: Thursday at 5PM the @DeptVetAffairs is hosting a free teletown hall to update you on their latest coronavirus response efforts - including the benefits available to you right now. To join the call dial in to 833-380-0417.  Learn more here: https://t.co/UO7f6cj0aH https://t.co/wwqiZGXBOL

ICYMI: @nbc4i's Colleen Marshall and I recently discussed police reform the #COVID19 pandemic and the need to work together in a bipartisan way to get solutions for folks in #OH15 and nationwide. You can watch by clicking this link: https://t.co/zNrQwS4AF0.

The deadline to apply for the #PaycheckProtectionProgram is today. If you have any questions or issues with applying for the #PPP or about coronavirus relief in general please call my Lancaster Office at 740-654-2654.    For more visit the @SBAgov at https://t.co/wq2I85xqb7 https://t.co/68fwuMldDE

#Ohio - find a #COVID19 testing site near you. More are opening throughout #OH15 in the coming days.  July 2➡️Circleville  Find more on this site and other sites near you at https://t.co/427Vxdhmlu https://t.co/bbRWwvmDhq

Last week the Subcommittee on Housing Community Development and Insurance held its first virtual hearing to discuss housing security as we continue to combat #COVID19. We need to find solutions that support renters and housing providers.

During #MilitaryAppreciationMonth we honor the courageous men and women who serve. Thank you for continuing to protect our communities during this pandemic even through non-traditional roles such as helping with #COVID19 testing at nursing homes. https://t.co/MHGot5ahhF https://t.co/ObizM1kYjq

Students in #OH15 and nationwide continued to work hard throughout the #COVID19 pandemic and they certainty earned the right to celebrate. Thanks to those at Canal Winchester High who safely honored their #2020Graduates virtually. https://t.co/IIlfUgESnJ

Appreciated the chance to speak with medical residents from @nationwidekids to provide an update on legislation in response to the coronavirus pandemic. We must continue working together so that our communities can rebound and come back stronger than ever. https://t.co/XK8JqkZcvH

JUST IN: @Walmart and @QuestDX have collaborated to open another drive-thru #COVID19 testing site in Circleville tomorrow. Any adult can get a test if they qualify under the @CDCgov #Ohio and local guidelines.   For more: https://t.co/MfYkCwJmDJ

Throughout the ongoing fight against the spread of coronavirus I'm thankful to the many partners like @fema who continue to supply the PPE our frontline workers need.   As of May 15 @femaregion5 has delivered $39.7m to #Ohio to assist areas of the state affected by #COVID19. https://t.co/f0oPiBaEXY

Congratulations on 55 years Head Start. The CARES Act included $750m to help them provide children a strong education foundation & encourage them to be the best they can against all challenges caused by #COVID19.  More on my efforts to support Head Start: https://t.co/qyLdwHy2Hb https://t.co/yCOtDONYes

To get your coronavirus stimulus check by direct deposit by 12pm TODAY you must update your banking information on the IRS's website. If you miss this deadline your check will arrive in the mail though it may take longer.  For more: https://t.co/N4lL2zqZwE https://t.co/xVL8XQWtWb

Honored to be named the 11th most bipartisan member of the House.  We can’t allow partisanship to stand in the way of solutions especially as we fight #COVID19. I'll keep working across the aisle to deliver results for folks in #OH15 and nationwide. https://t.co/zuoSgPkdju https://t.co/4WtUrP5a9Z

Consumer & retail stores open TODAY in #OH15. It is great to see our economy safely open back up but to defeat #COVID19 we must continue exercising best practices to stay healthy and prevent the spread as we move forward. More on #ResponsibleRestartOhio: https://t.co/xA3sIQsB89 https://t.co/MyFtdhUjMr

As we move forward in making a difference for all affected by #COVID19 we need to help families secure a safe place to call home. I'll continue leading efforts to find pragmatic solutions as Ranking Member of the @FinancialCmte Housing Subcommittee. More: https://t.co/aSvmqQWWqv
A strong fight Don. Stories like this about our #OH15 neighbors beating #COVID19 are an inspiration to us all. Let’s all continue to do our part to prevent the spread. https://t.co/52w5oMEmP1'

On #NationalNursesDay a big ‘thank you’ all nurses who devote their time to healing others. As our nation works to defeat #COVID19 you have been incredibly impressive working on the front lines. Your commitment is vital more vital than ever. https://t.co/TWUSFQJ2AK

ATTN Public Assistance Program applicants: @femaregion5 streamlined the existing application to help expedite COVID-19 relief. Those eligible to apply include local governments states tribes & certain private nonprofits. For more visit https://t.co/042HfLRDoa. https://t.co/axJAiEwlk2
If you are experiencing #COVID19 symptoms reach out to your health care provider for next steps to take.

Disinfectant products are important for wiping down surfaces to prevent the spread of germs but NOT as an internal treatment for coronavirus. I want to be clear DO NOT drink or inject yourself with a disinfectant.

This week is #NationalLabWeek and I want to recognize laboratory professionals for their innovation and their vital role in serving our communities. Thank you for your tireless work to improve the health of our nation and to defeat the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/eb1W5O8dXM

We’re fighting a battle and the medical professionals & first responders are on the front lines. I cosponsored the #HEROESAct to extend financial relief to those individuals. They‘re making tremendous sacrifices to combat #COVID19 & deserve this support. https://t.co/OqtXMuAG3y

Applications for the @FCC's COVID-19 Telehealth Program are now open. The CARES Act included $200m of support for this program to help health care providers safely and efficiently serve our communities during this pandemic. More on the application here: https://t.co/H1Na8Lb69H

ATTN Veterans: Today at 4PM the @DeptVetAffairs is hosting a free teletown hall to update you on their latest coronavirus response efforts - including the benefits available to you right now. To join the call dial in to 844-227-7557. More: https://t.co/0P3WRP9Dto https://t.co/JBZ5L3S2Gs

JUST NOW ➡️ @HHSGov has awarded grants to community health centers in #OH15 to combat #COVID19. To those working day-in and day-out to treat and care for our neighbors thank you. More: https://t.co/rlRIekA2SS https://t.co/3M8aR8z32Y

This #NationalPublicHealthWeek the health and well-being of the country has never been more important. Thanks to all who are working to beat #COVID19 now and keeping our communities healthy year-round. https://t.co/CMfdtAJ7gI

Along with my #Ohio colleagues I urged the #CoronavirusTaskForce to rush needed resources to those working hard to develop treatment options for #COVID19. Nothing should stand in the way of life-saving innovation. ⠀ ⠀ https://t.co/Gh2c3QgcIb https://t.co/ksdrAyQutg

Now more than ever it’s so important to recognize #NationalDoctorsDay and thank all doctors working around the clock to save lives. Thank you for your sacrifices in the fight against #COVID19 and for your commitment to keeping communities healthy across America. https://t.co/Dit8j5I4q1

Glad to see @USDANutrition has now implemented waivers to help #Ohio students access meals while we’re under this public health emergency. This was a provision I supported in the Families First Coronavirus Response Act because we have to ensure kids can access to nutritious food.

JUST NOW ➡️ Great news the FDA has approved @Battelle to utilize its sterilization systems at full capacity. Now upwards of 160000 masks per day can be reused in #Ohio giving our health care workers the critical PPE they need to fight #COVID19.

Questions about the resources available for small businesses impacted by #COVID19? Join me and a representative from the Small Business Administration on a conference call tomorrow to find out how to navigate the options for your #SmallBiz.

As rumors and disinformation become far too common let's focus on accurate information and ways to #FlattenTheCurve by using trusted sources. You can visit @fema's "Coronavirus Rumor Control" page to find the latest info on #COVID19 response efforts. https://t.co/dTltPhGE5P https://t.co/n5SzWRDygv

For folks looking to help here are tools from @FEMA on how to assist our communities in combating #COVID19. There are still impactful ways to provide relief for health care providers while practicing social distancing. We’re #InThisTogetherOhio. https://t.co/KOlMCuz5oD https://t.co/zEPnRlIGqF

ATTN Small Business Owners: please join me on Friday March 27th for a conference call about resources available for you as we continue to combat #COVID19.  A representative from the Small Business Administration will be on the line to help answer your questions. https://t.co/hMxrFQ5eje

For folks who are on the front lines in essential roles of #COVID19 or if you need transportation to visit the grocery or pharmacy @COTABus is still operating with modified service. For more information call #COTA at tel:614-228-1776 or visit https://t.co/VR8mQXeLAs https://t.co/DWzHT6tfHp

With #OH15 schools closed we have to ensure students continue to get nutritious food. Visit https://t.co/9RWOVMpxL5 or contact feedingkids@usda.gov to learn about free & reduced-price meals during #COVID19. Thanks to the #USDA & all who worked together to take care of our kids. https://t.co/m96FOfVQ0U
Need help filing for coronavirus-related unemployment? Go online at https://t.co/DKY5IIEdRL or call 1-877-644-6562. https://t.co/uwiGSZuzIO

Small businesses are the backbone of our economy and they’re facing unforeseen circumstances and uncertainty as a result of #COVID19. #SmallBiz in #OH15 can now apply for SBA loans to ensure they can continue to create jobs & drive America forward. More: https://t.co/GsEePMJChT https://t.co/JMi2ifVrIW

Experiencing one of #Ohio’s natural treasures is a good way to both stay active and practice social distancing during the #COVID19 pandemic. There’s plenty of room outside to keep the recommended six feet of distance! https://t.co/ZRa0JBFA1G

Right now institutions are taking steps to address the impact that the #COVID19 pandemic may be having on your finances. Find more information here on assistance your bank is offering to support you. https://t.co/6q9emN6EU7

We need to take extra steps to help vulnerable populations like those experiencing homelessness stay healthy. I joined @PatrickMcHenry to urge leaders of our Public Housing Authorities to implement policies that protect all communities against #COVID19. https://t.co/XnzdBMADly https://t.co/5qqAhQknvc

This comprehensive package includes free coronavirus testing food deliveries for seniors waivers for student’s school lunches and paid sick and family leave to allow Americans to recover from illness and care for loved ones infected by coronavirus.

Last night I voted in favor of the Families First Coronavirus Response Act. With the passage of this package we can expect to see relief for Americans affected by coronavirus. We all share the common goal of keeping our families safe and healthy.

Everyone should exercise caution and best practices for staying healthy and to prevent the spread to those at higher risk. If you‘re concerned that you may have been in contact with an individual known to have #COVID19 & you‘re exhibiting symptoms call your health care provider. https://t.co/YP9EaBMOzs

As of now there are 5 confirmed #COVID-19 cases in Ohio. Coronavirus poses a low risk to the general public but there are daily steps you can take to stay healthy. Learn more here: https://t.co/PlSjeh3T6M https://t.co/qyY5NA3lFr

Good news for #Ohio. The CDC has awarded $15.6 million to support state and local response to #COVID19. Thanks to the folks across the state who are working tirelessly to keep our communities healthy. https://t.co/aA9EtchP3R
Are you subscribed to my e-newsletter? Sign up now to receive updates related to #COVID19. https://t.co/4jPPNFb1nU
As we continue to monitor #COVID19 I will get you updates and more prevention guidance as they become available. In the meantime here are more tips I encourage you to follow. https://t.co/FBvAeqbSRL

Officials at the federal state and local level are working hard to combat #COVID19. If you have questions about Ohio's response you can call 1-833-4-ASK-ODH (1-833-427-5634) between 9:00 AM and 8:00 PM. https://t.co/s4PD3KGxs9
There's no confirmed cases of #COVID19 in #Ohio but prohibiting spectators at the #Arnold is in the best interest of public health. https://t.co/dey8iywAi7
Just today the House approved emergency funding to address the coronavirus at home and abroad and officials at all levels are working tirelessly to keep you safe. https://t.co/Z12JhaKO3K

Thankfully there are no confirmed cases of coronavirus in Ohio but it never hurts to take steps to prevent illnesses: ➡️Wash your hands regularly ➡️Avoid touching your nose/mouth ➡️Stay home if you’re sick ➡️Disinfect objects you use regularly  More info: https://t.co/XYkl2ap7wM
